intro: Rhyticarpus difformis, commonly known as the variable rhyticarpus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often asymmetrical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Rhyticarpus difformis is adapted to a range of habitats, including dry forests and woodlands.
